alert.note: Alert for Bryce Canyon Country; Capitol Reef National Park and Vicinity; Glen Canyon Recreation Area, Lake Powell; Lower Washington County; South Central Utah; Southern Mountains; Southwest Utah; Upper Sevier River Valleys; Zion National Park (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 22 at 2:48PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of Utah, including the following areas, Bryce Canyon Country, Capitol Reef National Park and Vicinity, Glen Canyon Recreation Area/Lake Powell, South Central Utah, Southern Mountains, Upper Sevier River Valleys, Lower Washington County, Southwest Utah and Zion National Park. * WHEN...Until Midnight MDT tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of slot canyons, normally dry washes, recently burned areas, rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A renewed monsoonal surge combined with the lingering moisture from remnants of what was Hurricane Hilary will bring a continued threat of flash flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Bryce Canyon Country; Capitol Reef National Park and Vicinity; Glen Canyon Recreation Area, Lake Powell; Lower Washington County; South Central Utah; Southern Mountains; Southwest Utah; Upper Sevier River Valleys; Zion National Park
